highlight_answers:
{"category": "Administrative Questions", "subcategory": "Eligibility & Compliance", "question": "What are the documents required to be submitted before submission deadline? List all of them and indicate how to prepare these docs.", "answer": "Mentioned  

The EOI submission deadline requires the following documents, all of which must be prepared and uploaded online before the stated cut‑off:

| Document | How to prepare it | Evidence |
|----------|-------------------|----------|
| **Expression of Interest (EOI) form** – Annexure‑I | Fill in all fields (consultant name, date of establishment, type of organisation, address, contact details, etc.) and sign digitally. | [Tendernotice_1.pdf, p:8](chunkref://8) |
| **Supporting documents** (brochures, narrative description of the firm, description of similar assignments, experience evidence, certificates from clients, etc.) – Annexure‑IV | Compile in English; if any material is in another language, provide a notarised English translation. | [Tendernotice_1.pdf, p:11](chunkref://12);[Tendernotice_1.pdf, p:4](chunkref://4) |
| **Letter of Intent or copy of existing agreement** (if the submission is by a Joint Venture) | Attach a clear letter of intent or the existing JV agreement, naming the lead firm and confirming the JV structure (≤3 members). | [Tendernotice_1.pdf, p:4](chunkref://4) |
| **Notarised translations** of any non‑English documents | Translate into English and have the translation notarised. | [Tendernotice_1.pdf, p:4](chunkref://4) |
| **Digital signature** of the consultant or authorised signatory | Sign all uploaded documents digitally as required by the tender. | [Tendernotice_1.pdf, p:4](chunkref://4) |
| **Undertaking (Annexure‑VI)** | Sign the undertaking certifying that all information is true and that any misleading information will lead to disqualification. | [Tendernotice_1.pdf, p:13](chunkref://15) |
| **Short‑Listing Criteria and Terms of Reference** | Download from the e‑procurement platform and include them in the submission. | [Tendernotice_1.pdf, p:3](chunkref://3) |
| **Any additional documents specified in the tender** | Upload each document one by one in the order indicated in the tender document. | [Tendernotice_1.pdf, p:4](chunkref://4) |

**Key preparation rules**

* All documents must be in English; supporting materials not translated into English will not be considered. | [Tendernotice_1.pdf, p:4](chunkref://4)  
* Translations must be notarised; the English version will prevail in evaluation. | [Tendernotice_1.pdf, p:4](chunkref://4)  
* The EOI must be complete and in the required format; incomplete or conditional EOI will not be entertained. | [Tendernotice_1.pdf, p:4](chunkref://4)  
* The entire EOI package must be submitted online before the due date/time (July 20, 2020 1500 hrs IST). | [Tendernotice_1.pdf, p:3](chunkref://3)

Consultant shall go through the guidelines provided under section‘I’and Section ‘II’before preparing EOI proposal.
2. Consultant who meet shortlisting criteria given in section ‘II’ shall prepare EOI as per the guidelines
given
in

the
Consultant
desires
to
submit certain information not covered in the guidelines would be in his interest, he
may submit such information.
3. The Application shall be the basis for drawing up a shortlist of eligible consultants who willbeinvitedtosubmitproposalforservicesrequired.
4. All Applications shall be submitted in English.

EOI may be in any other language provided that they are accompanied with translations
in the English language.Supporting materials,which are not translated into English,may
not be considered.For the purpose of interpretation and evaluation of the EOI,the
English language translation shall prevail. The translated documents from any other
language to English language shall be notorised.
7. The Applicant shall provide all the information sought under this shortlisting Criteria.Central
Water

would

only

EOI

onal EOI shall not be considered for short listing.
8. Detailed ToR will also be available on website www.damsafety.in
9. No EOI whatsoever will be entertained if submission is not received online by due date andtime.

knowledge. I also understand that any misleading or wrong information will disqualified this
application straightaway. President/Managing Director or Authorized Signatory of Applicant", "score": null, "source_collection": "tender_default-tenant_77fc0289-82fc-47c7-b69d-685cde19", "source_tool": null, "orig_size": [530.0, 379.0], "tender_id": "77fc0289-82fc-47c7-b69d-685cde198d60"}, {"chunk_id": 3, "file_name": "Tendernotice_1.pdf", "page": 3, "bbox": [0.15370018975332067, 0.11147540983606558, 0.9810246679316889, 0.980327868852459], "snippet": "Republic of India — The CPMU now invites eligible consulting firms (“consultants”) to indicate their interest
in providing the services.Interested consultants should provide information demonstrating
that they have the required qualifications and relevant experience to perform the services
(brochures,description of similar assignments,experience in similar conditions, availability of
appropriate skills among staff,etc.). Key Experts will not be evaluated at the shortlisting
stage. The detailed shortlisting criteria are mentioned in Section II of the EoI. Consultants may associate with other firms in the form of a joint venture to enchance their
Qualifications. The EOI submitted by consultants in association should clearly indicate
the nature of the association if it is a joint venture. In case of Joint venture, the name of
the lead firm should be clearly stated and the JV should not have more than three
members including the lead. The attention of interested Consultants is drawn to paragraph 3.16,3.17: “Conflict of Interest”
and paragraph 3.32: “Fraud & Corruption” of the World Bank’s Procurement Regulations for
IPF Borrowersdated July 2016, revised November 2017 and August 2018, setting forth the
World Bank’s policy. Consultants will be selected in accordance with the Quality and cost Based selection (QCBS
method set out in the Procurment Regulations for IPF Borrowers. The consultant/bidders can
download the Expression of Interest(EoI)comprising‘ShortListingCriteria’and ‘Terms of
Reference from the e‐procurement platform (https://eprocure.gov.in/eprocure/app) fromMay
22,2020, 1000hrs(IST)onwards.TheBiddersneed to submittheEoI along with all relevant
documents online through eprocurement platform(https://eprocure.gov.in/eprocure/app). Last
date/time for receipt of bid through e‐procurement is on July 20 ,2020 upto 1500 hrs (IST).
Late and offline bids shall not be accepted.The‘Short Listing Criteria’and‘Scope of Work’are
also available in the DRIP websitehttp://www.damsafety.in. Interested consultants may obtain further information at the address below from 0930hrsto
1730hrs (Monday to Friday, except Govt. holidays). The office of the Project Director,
DRIP Phase II and Phase III,
Central Water Commmission, 8th Floor, SewaBhawan
R K Puram, N Delhi-110066, India
PhoneNo.:+91-11-26106848,
projectdr.drip-cwc@gov.in", "score": null, "source_collection": "tender_default-tenant_77fc0289-82fc-47c7-b69d-685cde19", "source_tool": null, "orig_size": [527.0, 610.0], "tender_id": "77fc0289-82fc-47c7-b69d-685cde198d60"}, {"chunk_id": 4, "file_name": "Tendernotice_1.pdf", "page": 4, "bbox": [0.18470149253731344, 0.17575757575757575, 0.9832089552238806, 0.9818181818181818], "snippet": "Republic of India — Instruction for submission of Expression of Interest 1. project_card_fields.Project Scope:
Phase: Implementation and Rehabilitation  
Scope: Project Planning and Programming, Design Review, Procurement Management, Financial Management, Project Monitoring, Environmental and Social Management Framework (ESMF) Compliance, Dam Safety Institutional Strengthening, Preparation of Emergency Action Plans (EAPs) and Operation & Maintenance (O&M) Manuals, Third-Party Construction Supervision & Quality Assurance, Web-based MIS Development, and Coordination with SPMUs and CPMU.
project_card_fields.location: Asia, Republic of India, 19 States and three Central Agencies including Central Water Commission
